the windowing of the data.
We can do this using NumPy, ﬁrst slicing the array and only keeping the second half of each
window, then ﬂattening the windows into a long vector for each variable. This is quick and dirty
and does mean that we lose the data in the ﬁrst half of the ﬁrst window.
# remove overlap
cut = int(trainX.shape[1] / 2)
longX = trainX[:, -cut:, :]
# flatten windows
longX = longX.reshape((longX.shape[0] * longX.shape[1], longX.shape[2]))
